templates/about.mustache.app_about:
Spaces introduces SMU Libraries' two physical libraries through photos and quick facts.

SMU Libraries is the heartbeat of Singapore Management University, a centre where researchers and learners converge to share and acquire academic and professional knowledge.

Together, Li Ka Shing Library and Kwa Geok Choo Law Library offer more than 11,000m2 of learning spaces to the SMU community.

slides.title: Li Ka Shing Library
slides.caption:
The Li Ka Shing Library was officially opened on 24 February 2006 by Minister Mentor Lee Kuan Yew and Hong Kong businessman Dr. Li Ka-Shing, whom the Library is named after. The Li Ka Shing Foundation donated an endowment for library collections.

The building has unique architectural features that let in abundant natural light. Greenery cascades down the library's modern, curvilinear facade.
SMU Libraries has more than 380,000 printed and electronic books, 80,000 print and electronic journals, 160 eletronic databases and 17,000 SMU research publications.
Li Ka Shing library has a seating capacity of 1,800 spread over four floors.

slides.title: Investment Studio
slides.caption: The Investment Studio is a dedicated space for accessing high-end financial databases, including Bloomberg, Eikon, Capital IQ.
Users can hone their technical skills in business research in a professional environment.

slides.title: Hive
slides.caption: The Hive is specially designed to support active group learning. It is usually open for student use but it can be reserved for lessons and events.
The Hive has flexible seating and six inter-connected projection screens. The space can accommodate 50 people when closed off.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: The Learning Commons is a 24-hour study space that supports both group and individual learning.
For those seeking inspiration, floor-to-ceiling windows look out to the Campus Green.
A mix of booth tables, group seating and individual carrels cater to different learning styles.

slides.title: Learning Lab 1
slides.caption: Learning Labs 1 & 2 in the Li Ka Shing Library are equipped with video-conferencing technology and flexible furniture.
The Learning Labs are usually open for student use but they can be reserved for meetings, lessons or events. The Labs can be used separately or combined into a single, larger event space.

slides.title: Learning Lab 2
slides.caption: The tables can be configured for different activity and group sizes.

slides.title: Lounge
slides.caption: The Lounge offers popular books, DVDs, magazines and newspapers (and sometimes Smoo Smoo) in a comfortable setting.

slides.title: DVD Collection
slides.caption: Cheaper and wider range than Netflix Singapore.

slides.title: Lifestyle Collection
slides.caption: The Lifestyle Collection includes award-winning titles, travel guides, popular non-fiction and Singapore literature.
Relax in the Lounge with a newspaper and a cuppa (with a lid).

slides.title: Project Rooms
slides.caption: There are project rooms on all floors of the Li Ka Shing Library for group discussions and project work.
The project room under the stairs.

Discussion with Smoo Smoo.

All project rooms have wireless projection and a white board.

slides.title: L2 Quiet Area
slides.caption: Quiet Areas are for work that require intense concentration. There is a mix of tables and carrels in the L2 Quiet Area.

slides.title: L4 Quiet Area
slides.caption: The L4 Quiet Area is a Hog-Free zone.

slides.title: L5 Quiet Area
slides.caption: The spacious L5 Quiet Area is sometimes used for events and seminars.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge
slides.caption: The Graduate Lounge is a study area exclusive to graduate students ...
... and the occasional visitor.
The Lounge is a sanctuary of peace and quiet, away from the bubbly undergraduates.

slides.title: Rooftop Garden
slides.caption: The rooftop garden offers space for relaxation and contemplation. Please do not smoke here.
A view of the Singapore Art Museum dome, and the Rochor area in the distance.
A view of the National Museum of Singapore. In the background, Orchard Road.
The rooftop garden is closed after 7:30pm.

slides.title: Study Booths
slides.caption: Study booths with LCD screens are located on L3 and L4.
Booths can be booked online for project discussion and presentation rehearsals.
Each booth can comfortably seat 6 (or, uncomfortably, 10).

slides.title: Kwa Geok Choo Law Library
slides.caption:
The Kwa Geok Choo Law Library is SMU's second library. It was officially opened by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on 15 March 2017.

The library has seating space for approximately 500 users and it is open to the entire SMU community.

The Kwa Geok Choo Law Library hosts a print collection of 21,000 volumes.

The Law Collection is located on L4 and consists of textbooks, law reports and international legal journals.

slides.title: Atrium
slides.caption: The Atrium offers casual study spaces for users to enjoy.
Faculty publications on display are not for loan or browsing.
The early bird catches the worm.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: The Learning Commons is a 24/7 study space for those who want to carry on working after library opening hours.
There are two entrances to the Learning Commons: one is just outside the library and the other is within the School of Law. The latter is closed at 10:30pm.
The Learning Commons can seat about 100.

slides.title: Learning Labs 3 & 4
slides.caption: Learning Labs 3 & 4 are often used to hold library events, including seminars and workshops.
When not in used for training, users are welcome to use it for their own personal study.
The Learning Labs can be combined to create a larger event venue.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge
slides.caption: The Kwa Geok Choo Law Library provides a Graduate Lounge exclusively for graduate students.
There is a dedicated meeting room within the Lounge for group discussions.
Mid-assignment brooding.

slides.title: Project Rooms
slides.caption: 13 project rooms can be booked by undergraduate and graduate students for group study and discussion. The orange couches outside have built-in power outlets.
The rooms are equipped with a wireless collaboration and presentation system that allow projection from multiple devices simultaneously.

slides.title: L4 Quiet Area
slides.caption: There is a spacious quiet area on L4 where students can study while enjoying the view of Fort Canning Park.
These "Business Class" seats offer users a cosy space to curl up in.

slides.title: L5 Quiet Area
slides.caption: There are individual study carrels on L5.

slides.title: Terrace
slides.caption: The terrace is accessible from 8:00am to 7:30pm for those who need to stretch and take in a bit of fresh air.
You can admire the view of Fort Canning Park here.
Goodbye, Smoo Smoo!
